Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Emma Jordan-Simpson, Association Minister, Concord Baptist Church of Christ, 833 Gardner Taylor Blvd, Brooklyn, NY 11216.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Vann.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Emma Jordan-Simpson, Association Mimister, Concord Baptist Church of Christ, 833 Gardner Taylor Blvd, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11216.

Council Member Vann moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of January 9, 2008 be adopted as printed by Council Member Gennaro.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Gennaro moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of January 9, 2008 be adopted as printed.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Krueger, S.1673, and Assembly Member Lopez, A.4069, “AN ACT to amend the local emergency housing rent control act, in relation to rent regulation laws”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Local emergency housing rent control act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature adopt, and the Governor to sign, A.9550/S.6539 which would provide homeowners in New York City an abatement of real property taxes for the installation cost of sewer improvement check valve devices.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Provide homeowners in New York City an abatement of real property taxes for the installation cost of sewer improvement check valve devices.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.3244-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.5754-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to allowing members of the New York city employees’ retirement system and the New York city board of education employees’ retirement system to elect the benefits provided by chapter 96 of the laws of 1995”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: NYCERS and BOEERS elect benefits provided by Chapter 96 of 1995 (S.3244-A, A.5754-A).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.4894-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7063-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the application of the age fifty-seven retirement program, the mandated physically taxing program, and the incumbent fifty-five/twenty-five program for certain employees”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Fifty-seven retirement program (S.4894-A, A.7063-A).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.6211-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8449-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to providing benefit enhancements to certain members of retirement systems in the city of New York”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Benefit enhancements to certain members of city retirement systems (S.6211-A, A.8449-A).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.3314-A, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.5961-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to coverage for additional members of the New York city employees’ retirement system”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Coverage for additional members of the NYCERS (S.3314-A, A.5961-A).

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.6861, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8377-A, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, the administrative code of the city of New York and the education law, in relation to the establishment of a twenty-five year retirement program for members of the New York city employees’ retirement system or the board of education retirement system of the city of New York employed in construction laborer positions.”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Twenty-five year program for members of NYCERS or BOERS of New York employed in construction laborer positions (S.6861, A.8377-A).

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the sale of meat from animals produced by cloning.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: The sale of meat from animals produced by cloning.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey to provide inductive loop Assistive Listening Systems in New York City’s airports, John F. Kennedy International Airport and La Guardia Airport, to allow for the improved broadcast of airport information, instructions, and safety notices to hearing impaired individuals.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Provide inductive loop Assistive Listening Systems in New York City’s airports, John F. Kennedy International Airport and La Guardia Airport.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the tow advisory board.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Tow advisory board.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to rates for the towing of motor vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Rates for the towing of motor vehicles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reflective vests for commercial bicyclists.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Reflective vests for commercial bicyclists.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the establishment of the Park Slope Fifth Avenue Business Improvement District in the Borough of Brooklyn and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Park Slope Fifth Avenue BID in the Borough of Brooklyn.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring information on working conditions from foreign manufacturers of goods.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Contracts
Items.MatterName: Requiring information on working conditions from foreign manufacturers of goods.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Fire Department of the City of New York to send bi-annual written notice to all residents of New York City reminding them to check the operation of their smoke alarms and carbon monoxide detectors and other fire prevention information.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: FDNY  to send bi-annual written notice to all residents of NYC reminding them to check the operation of their smoke alarms and carbon monoxide detectors and other fire prevention information.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring that the affidavits required for the filing of a real property transfer tax return on the sale of one- or two- family dwellings as well as cooperative and condominium apartments indicate that the premises sold is equipped with an operational carbon monoxide detecting device as well as a smoke detecting device.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Sale of one- or two- family dwellings as well as cooperative and condominium apartments indicate that the premises sold is equipped with an operational carbon monoxide detecting device as well as a smoke detecting device.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce and adopt, and the Governor to sign, legislation which would authorize the city of New York to establish a Small Performance Venue Business Tax Credit.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Authorize the city of New York to establish a Small Performance Venue Business Tax Credit.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to incorporate the Muslim holidays of Eid Ul-Fitr and Eid Ul-Adha as observed school holidays in the school calendar for the city school district of the city of New York, and calling upon the State legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign into law, A.8108/S.5837, an Act to amend the education law, in relation to requiring that Eid Ul-Fitr and Eid Ul-Adha be school holidays in the city school district of the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Department of Education to incorporate the Muslim holidays of Eid Ul-Fitr and Eid Ul-Adha as observed school holidays.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Cultural Affairs to ensure the equitable distribution of funds to cultural organizations, greater transparency in the funding of these organizations and diverse representation within all entities that determine funding to cultural organizations.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Ensure the equitable distribution of funds to cultural organizations.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State of New York to pass A.3873/S.1865, legislation that would amend the Administrative Code of the City of New York and the retirement and social security law by expanding the term “physically taxing occupation” to include registered nurses and midwives employed by the City of New York or the New York City Health and Hospitals Corporation.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Expanding the term “physically taxing occupation” to include registered nurses and midwives employed by the City of New York or the NYC HHC.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing a credit against the commercial rent or occupancy tax imposed by chapter 7 of title 11 of such code, to tenants who provide employer-provided child care.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Providing a credit against the commercial rent or occupancy tax imposed by chapter 7 of title 11 of such code, to tenants who provide employer-provided child care.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to enact legislation authorizing the city of New York to provide tax incentives to businesses that offer child care assistance to employees.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the city of New York to provide tax incentives to businesses that offer child care assistance to employees.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to healthcare expenses for certain 9/11 workers.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Healthcare expenses for certain 9/11 workers.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to real estate advertising in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Real estate advertising in New York City.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the display of the POW/MIA flag on all city buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Display of the POW/MIA flag on all city buildings that display the American flag.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to new hybrid electric vehicle parking.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: New hybrid electric vehicle parking.

Items.Title: Resolution officially designating “Gotham City” as the nickname of New York City.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Officially designating “Gotham City” as the nickname of New York City.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature and the Governor to amend the New York State Tax Law to authorize the City of New York to provide an income tax credit equal to $100 for the purchase of gasoline for hybrid vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Amend the NYS Tax Law to authorize NYC to provide an income tax credit equal to $100 for the purchase of gasoline for hybrid vehicles.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce and pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation which would provide a sales and compensating use tax exemption for the purchase of hybrid vehicles.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Provide a sales and compensating use tax exemption for the purchase of hybrid vehicles.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring all professionals who participate in the professional certification program at the department of buildings to carry professional liability insurance.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring all professionals who participate in the professional certification program at the department of buildings to carry professional liability insurance.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the resale of mattresses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Resale of mattresses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the extension of the Bryant Park business improvement district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Extension of the Bryant Park BID.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the district plan of the Bryant Park business improvement district to change the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Amending the district plan of the Bryant Park BID to change the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of the Park Slope Fifth Avenue business improvement district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Establishment of the Park Slope Fifth Avenue BID.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning an amendment to the District Plan of the Bryant Park Business Improvement District that provides for a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based, and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing of the local law authorizing a change in the method of assessment upon which the district charge in the Bryant Park Business Improvement District is based.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Amending the district plan of the Bryant Park BID to change the method of assessment upon which the district charge is based.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the extension of the Bryant Park Business Improvement District in the Borough of Manhattan and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the extension of such district
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Extension of the Bryant Park BID.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Governor of the State of New York and the Department of Motor Vehicles to ensure that driver’s education courses include more comprehensive lessons on sharing the road with cyclists and that road tests and written driving exams include more thorough testing on precautions relating to cyclists.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Governor of NYS and the Department of Motor Vehicles to ensure that driver’s education courses include more comprehensive lessons on sharing the road with cyclists.

Items.Title: Communication from the Business Integrity Commission – Submitting annual report (July 1, 2006 – June 30, 2007) entitled “Report of the Commissioner of the Business Integrity Commission to the City Council Regarding Activities at the New Fulton Fish Market at Hunts Point, The New York City Terminal Produce Cooperative Market, The Hunts Point Cooperative Market, and The Brooklyn Wholesale Meat Market”, pursuant to Sections 22-226 and 22-269 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York .

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting climbing, jumping or suspending of oneself from structures.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Senate to pass the Secure Handling of Ammonium Nitrate Act of 2007.

Items.MatterName: US Senate to pass the Secure Handling of Ammonium Nitrate Act of 2007.

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 080043 HAM, an Urban Development Action Area Designation and Project, located at 2282 and 2284 Frederick Douglass Boulevard and the disposition of such property, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 9.  This matter is subject to Council Review and action pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter and Article 16 of the General Municipal Law.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: UDAAP, 2282 and 2284 Frederick Douglass Boulevard, Manhattan (C080043HAM)

Items.Title: Uniform land use review procedure application no. C 080044 PQM, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter concerning the acquisition of property, located at 2282-2284 Frederick Douglass Boulevard, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 9. This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, 2282-2284 Frederick Douglass Boulevard, Manhattan (C080044PQM)

Items.Title: Application no. 20085154 TCM, pursuant to §20-226 of the Administrative Code of the City of New York, concerning the petition of. Eisen and Son, Inc., d/b/a Lasagna Ristorante, to continue to maintain and operate an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 196 Eighth Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 3.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to Rule 11.20b of the Council and §20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Sidewalk Cafe, 196 Eighth Avenue, Manhattan (20085154TCM)
